channel.title: Clojure dict implementation
channel.description:
yeah yeah implementation of RFC2229 in clojure.
[code](ns anthony.dict.dictclient (import (java.net Socket) (java.io OutputStreamWriter BufferedWriter InputStreamReader BufferedReader)) (:require [clojure.string :as str]))
(defn write-line [writer line] (doto writer (.write line) (.newLine) (.flush)))
(defn get-response-code [line] (get (str/split line #"\s") 0))
(defn get-response-data [line] (get (str/split line #"\s" 2) 1))
(defn parse-text-block [dict-input] (loop [line (.readLine dict-input) lines []] (if (.startsWith line ".") lines (recur (.readLine dict-input) (conj lines line)))))
(defn push-command [conn-info command & args] (let [dict-sock (:sock conn-info) dict-input (:reader conn-info) dict-output (:writer conn-info)] (write-line dict-output (str/join " " (cons command args))) (let [line (.readLine dict-input) response-code (Integer/parseInt (get-response-code line)) text-responses #{114 113 112 111 110 152} join-responses #{114 113 112 152}] (if (text-responses response-code) (if (join-responses response-code) (str/join "\r\n" (parse-text-block dict-input)) (parse-text-block dict-input)) {:response response-code :reason (get-response-data line)}))))
(defn connect [host port] (let [dict-sock (Socket. host port) dict-input (BufferedReader. (InputStreamReader. (.getInputStream dict-sock))) dict-output (BufferedWriter. (OutputStreamWriter. (.getOutputStream dict-sock))) line (.readLine dict-input) response-code (Integer/parseInt (get-response-code line))] (if (== response-code 220) ; connection success! {:sock dict-sock :reader dict-input :writer dict-output :response response-code} (do (.close dict-sock) {:response response-code :reason (get-response-data line)}))))
(defn define [conn-info db word] (let [dict-sock (:sock conn-info) dict-input (:reader conn-info) dict-output (:writer conn-info)] (write-line dict-output (str "DEFINE " db " " word)) (let [line (.readLine dict-input) response-code (Integer/parseInt (get-response-code line))] (if (== response-code 150) ; got definition {:definition-info (get-response-data (.readLine dict-input)) :definition (str/join "\r\n" (parse-text-block dict-input))} {:response response-code :reason (get-response-data line)}))))
(defn client [conn-info client-info] (push-command conn-info "CLIENT" client-info))
(defn auth [conn-info user auth-str] (push-command conn-info "AUTH" user auth-str))
(defn match [conn-info db strat word] (push-command conn-info "MATCH" db strat word))
(defn show-dictionaries [conn-info] (push-command conn-info "SHOW DB" nil))
(defn show-strategies [conn-info] (push-command conn-info "SHOW STRAT" nil))
(defn show-info [conn-info database] (push-command conn-info "SHOW INFO" database))
(defn help [conn-info] (push-command conn-info "HELP" nil))
(defn show-server [conn-info] (push-command conn-info "SHOW SERVER" nil))
(defn status [conn-info] (push-command conn-info "STATUS" nil))
(defn quit [conn-info] (push-command conn-info "QUIT" nil))
(let [conn-shit (connect "dict.org" 2628)] (println (show-server conn-shit)))[/code]

item.title: Clojure dict implementation
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:25, topic:410958”][quote author=_s link=topic=512222.msg3719820#msg3719820 date=1313866133]

[quote author=Uncalled link=topic=512222.msg3719813#msg3719813 date=1313865847]

I’ll leave it with this, I refuse to speak with you; just let it be known that you act very childish, I do hope you don’t act like this on other websites you’re on and just have a hatred for MoparScape, so you act immature on here. If you act like this on every website, I’m disappointed, to think that I respected you for your coding ability before I knew how you acted, but if you say, “I act like this on every website.” or anything of the matter, I’ll lose all the respect I had for you. Though judging on the way you act, I’m going to assume that you didn’t take the time to read [or half-ass read] what I stated above.

But again, leaving it at this.

read my edit

also…

I act like this on every website.
[/quote]Just read your edit, never did I state that I disliked Lisps, in fact; I have great respect for that language.
I know I said that I’d leave it at that, but I can’t let you think that I don’t like Lisp, I like Lisp more than Java.

misinterpreted your opinion of ugliness for dislike, usually someone that likes lisp wouldn’t ever call it ugly because of the elegance that’s underneath the parentheses.
[/quote]I haven’t worked with it enough to see the elegance in it yet, I’ve been working with it more than what I used to.[/quote]
s-expressions are the root of all that is good

item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:15, topic:410958”][quote author=_s link=topic=512222.msg3719737#msg3719737 date=1313862686]

I know it’s not if that comment was directed towards me, it’s a high-level programming language.

using lower level languages doesn’t make you cool
[/quote]Now why must you go on about putting others down every time you’re on MoparScape, you seem to have a God-like opinion of yourself. You point out flaws in other people and bash on them for no reason, yet you, and others, fail to do the same with you, now I don’t expect you to put yourself down; just be aware that you have flaws as-well. I don’t even know you, it’s completely uncalled for that you must disrespect me; this may be the first time I’ve talked to you. I’ve never directed a disrespectful comment towards you and I still don’t plan on doing so, I’m against flaming; you seem to live for it.

I suggest you lose that God-like structure you do seem to think you have and possibly grow up a little. You act very childish by constantly flaming others, I do think you seem as if you can get away with constantly bashing on others as I’ve failed to see others actually win in an argument with you; I find it plain ridiculous to have an argument over the internet, so I’ll leave it at this.
If any of this offended you in anyway [highly doubted, I’m just making sure] then I apologize in advance, it’s not, nor will it ever be, my intentions to offend anyone through internet-contact.[/quote]
Congratulations! You are the 1000000th person to notice this! Click here to claim your prize!

edit: what the fuck happened there, i was editing my post and it weirded up. oh well. yeah, whatever.

i’m talking about one comprehending every line of the code and understanding the exact semantics of how it works, not just the general idea. also, lisps are elegant languages when you look at them in the proper way and you understand why they do things in the way that they do and understand the power and possibilities that stem from the way they do things
